intro: Hieracium wilczekianum subsp. muerrense, commonly known as the Mürren hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
